author: 20-EverGreen-2
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Make manually any file with EM DASH character on filename like:

"this is a — file input.txt"

and copy filepath to clipboard

# NEXT ON POWERSHELL WINDOW
Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
# HIT ENTER
# PASTE CLIPBOARD WITH RIGHT CLICK, THEN HIT ENTER AGAIN

### Expected behavior

```console
PS C:\>Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
"C:\some directory\this is a — file input.txt"

    Directory: some directory


Mode                 LastWriteTime         Length Name
----                 -------------         ------ ----
-a----        14/09/2022     13:18              0 this is a — file input.txt
```


### Actual behavior

```console
PS C:\>Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
"C:\some directory\this is a — file input.txt" # this is a input text from clipboard via right click!!!
Get-ItemProperty: Cannot find path 'C:\some directory\this is a — file input.txt' because it does not exist.
PS C:\>
```


### Error details

```console
PS C:\> Get-Error

Exception             :
    Type                 : System.Management.Automation.ItemNotFoundException
    ErrorRecord          :
        Exception             :
            Type    : System.Management.Automation.ParentContainsErrorRecordException
            Message : Cannot find path 'C:\some directory	his is a — file input.txt' because it
does not exist.
            HResult : -2146233087
        TargetObject          : C:\some directory	his is a — file input.txt
        CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\some directory\this…file input.txt:String) [], ParentContainsErrorRecordException
        FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound
    ItemName             : C:\some directory	his is a — file input.txt
    SessionStateCategory : Drive
    TargetSite           :
        Name          : GetGlobbedMonadPathsFromMonadPath
        DeclaringType : System.Management.Automation.LocationGlobber, System.Management.Automation, Version=7.2.6.500, Culture=neutral,
PublicKeyToken=31bf3856ad364e35
        MemberType    : Method
        Module        : System.Management.Automation.dll
    Message              : Cannot find path 'C:\some directory	his is a — file input.txt' because
it does not exist.
    Source               : System.Management.Automation
    HResult              : -2146233087
    StackTrace           :
   at System.Management.Automation.LocationGlobber.GetGlobbedMonadPathsFromMonadPath(String path, Boolean allowNonexistingPaths, CmdletProviderContext
context, CmdletProvider& providerInstance)
   at System.Management.Automation.LocationGlobber.GetGlobbedProviderPathsFromMonadPath(String path, Boolean allowNonexistingPaths,
CmdletProviderContext context, ProviderInfo& provider, CmdletProvider& providerInstance)
   at System.Management.Automation.SessionStateInternal.GetProperty(String[] paths, Collection`1 providerSpecificPickList, CmdletProviderContext context)
   at System.Management.Automation.PropertyCmdletProviderIntrinsics.Get(String path, Collection`1 providerSpecificPickList, CmdletProviderContext
context)
   at Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetItemPropertyCommand.ProcessRecord()
TargetObject          : C:\some directory	his is a — file input.txt
CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\some directory\this…file input.txt:String) [Get-ItemProperty], ItemNotFoundException
FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetItemPropertyCommand
InvocationInfo        :
    MyCommand        : Get-ItemProperty
    ScriptLineNumber : 1
    OffsetInLine     : 1
    HistoryId        : 2
    Line             : Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
    PositionMessage  : At line:1 char:1
                       + Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
                       + ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    InvocationName   : Get-ItemProperty
    CommandOrigin    : Internal
ScriptStackTrace      : at <ScriptBlock>, <No file>: line 1
PipelineIterationInfo :




PS C:\>
```


### Environment data

```powershell
PS C:\> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.6

SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```


### Visuals

_No response_

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
```powershell
Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath (Read-Host).Replace('"','')
Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath (Read-Host).Replace('"',$null)
Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath (Read-Host).Replace("`"","")    # also working
```

```

Hi [jhoneill](https://github.com/jhoneill) !!!

Maybe you need to copy the character from app like babelmap.

Character code from this app in UCN format is: \u2014
HTML format: —
this is the character again: — 
I tried to upload a file with the character.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> i try to change settings same as you have.

change in intl.cpl to UTF8, reboot and add to $profile: `$PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'`

comments.author: 20-EverGreen-2
comments.body:
> > i try to change settings same as you have.
> 
> change in intl.cpl to UTF8, reboot and add to $profile: `$PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'`

I try, but not luck.

`PS Q:\tmp> Get-ItemProperty -LiteralPath $((Read-Host).Replace("`"",""))
this is a - file input.txt
Get-ItemProperty: Cannot find path 'this is a - file input.txt' because it does not exist.
PS Q:\tmp> $host.CurrentCulture

LCID             Name             DisplayName
----             ----             -----------
1033             en-US            English (United States)

PS Q:\tmp> [console]::InputEncoding | Select WindowsCodePage, EncodingName

WindowsCodePage EncodingName
--------------- ------------
           1200 Unicode (UTF-8)

PS Q:\tmp> chcp
Página de códigos activa: 65001`

I set beta support for UTF-8 on intl.cpl.
And this powershell command 
`$profile: $PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'`

Returns error

`PS Q:\tmp> $PROFILE: $PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'
ParserError:
Line |
   1 |  $PROFILE: $PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'
     |  ~~~~~~~~~
     | Variable reference is not valid. ':' was not followed by a valid variable name character. Consider
     | using ${} to delimit the name.`

comments.author: 20-EverGreen-2
comments.body: Im running out of ideas.

comments.author: 237dmitry
comments.body:
> And this powershell command

Add this in `$profile` )) or execute command in console (it works only for current session)
```
$PSDefaultParameterValues['*:Encoding'] = 'Default'
```
If `$profile` does not exist you can create it.
```
if (-not (Test-path $profile)) { new-item $profile -Force }  # Documents\PowerShell\Microsoft.PowerShell_profile.ps1
```

> Two form are same for me at least.
> And notice the character has changed to a "-" minus symbol!!!

So either what is going into the clipboard has a "-" , or it gets converted as it goes through the clipboard. It's not read-host 


I tested this  

```

105
115

105

32

```

You might want to paste what is in the clipboard into something else, check you still have an em-dash.

title: read-host bug
